Welcome to contacts app’s documentation!¶

contacts app main¶

contacts app repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactsModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contacts¶
The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.
Args:

body (ContactsModel): The ContactsModel schema model to be created in the database. user (User): The User schema model that is creating this contact, used for foreign key relationship with contacts table. db (Session): The SQLAlchemy session object.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactsModel: Create a new contact

  • user – User: Get the user id from the user object

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The newly created contact

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contacts¶

The get_contact function takes in a database session, contact_id, and user. It then queries the database for a Contact with the given id and user_id. If it finds one, it returns that Contact object.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id

  • user – User: Ensure that the user is logged in and has access to the contact

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contacts]¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the user.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first n contacts

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • user – User: Filter the contacts by user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_with_birthdays(db: Session, user: User)¶

The get_contacts_with_birthdays function returns a list of contacts with birthdays in the next week.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the database

Returns:

A list of contact objects

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contacts | None¶
The remove_contact function deletes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to delete. user (User): The user who is deleting the contact. db (Session): The database session to use for querying.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact to delete

  • user – User: Make sure that the user is authorized to delete the contact

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The deleted contact

src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(db: Session, query: str, user: User) → List[Contacts]¶

The search_contacts function searches the database for contacts that match a given query.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • query – str: Search for a contact by first name, last name or email

  • user – User: Get the user id of the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the query

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactsModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contacts | None¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Find the contact in the database

  • body – ContactsModel: Get the data from the request body

  • user – User: Ensure that the user is only able to update their own contacts

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The updated contact

async src.repository.contacts.update_status_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactsStatusUpdate, user: User, db: Session)¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Find the contact in the database

  • body – ContactsStatusUpdate: Get the data from the request body

  • user – User: Ensure that the user is only able to update their own contacts

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The updated contact

contacts app repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session. It then gets the user by their email, sets their confirmed status to True, and commits the changes to the database.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user to be confirmed

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session to the function

Returns:

None

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Define the data that will be used to create a new user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user with that email. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the type of the parameter

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of data that will be passed to the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object, which is a row in the users table

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user

  • token – Optional[str]: Pass in the token that is returned from the spotify api

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None
